titleStmt.title: List of Manuscripts in languages of Central Asia and Sanskrit
titleStmt.author: Barnett, Lionel D.

head.p: This catalogue was compiled as a handlist for the manuscripts in languages of Central Asia and Sanskrit in the British Museum (now in the British Library).

note.p: Omitted in report.
Non-Sanskritic (Proto-Tibetan?). Brahmi
Birch-bark fragments.
Prajnaparamitasutra
Fol. 352 of Prajñāpāramitāsūtra.
Prajñāpāramitāsūtra (fol. 732)
Prajñāpāramitāsūtra (fol. nos. 126, 127, 128, 129)
Grammatical text.
Omitted in report.
A work on Buddhist doctrine, in Uighur, with Chinese rubrics. 2 vols, written on rice paper in the manner of Chinese MSS.

Three fragments of a Turki register, in "Runic" script, of names of persons leaving the fort at Miran during its occupation by a Turki garrison, apparently not later than circa 750 A.D. Published in J.R.A.S., 1912, p.181.
On the back, a Tibetan version ofPrajñāpāramitāhṛdaya. From the Caves of the Thousand Buddhas.

Turki letter in 'Runic' script, written by a person namedBaghatur Chigshi, perhaps a military official, apparently in the 9th century, giving an account of some arrangments of the military staff, and making complaints about the commissariat.
One large and four smaller fragments in Kok Turki.
One small fragment in Kok Turki.
Four and a half folios ofVessantara Jātakain Sogdian. Published by Gauthiot in Journal Asiatique, 1912, pp. 163 & 429.
One folio, 93 lines, of a Sogdian work.
Large fragment of document in Sogdian. Chinese docket on back.
Fragment in Sogdian. With Chinese on back.
Fragment in Sogdian. With Chinese on back.
Roll containing a Buddhist text (Abhidharma?) in Sogdian. 402 lines.

Paper fragment, probably of the Tang period. One one side, part of a Sutra in Chinese, on both sides is writing in an alphabet resembling the Uighur, in a language which is apparently debased Sogdian. The name of titleAllp Taran occurs twice; the namesIl-bars,Qutluq,Pansar, etc., are found.
Small fragment, on one side of the paper Sogdian, on the other Chinese.
Fragment of a roll with 29 lines of Sogdian writing.
Large sheet of paper containing a letter (21 lines), in Sogdian.
A wooden slip, with inscrition in Sogdian.
Small fragment of wood, with illegible writing, apparently Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper in early Sogdian. Forms part of the same document as Or.8212 (100).
Large fragment of paper in early Sogdian. Forms part of the same document as Or.8212 (100).
Large fragment of paper in early Sogdian. Forms part of the same document as Or.8212 (100).
Document in early Sogdian, on a sheet of paper.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Large fragment of paper document in early Sogdian.
Document in early Sogdian on a sheet of paper.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Fragment of a paper document in early Sogdian. Forms part of same document as Or. 8212 (94)
Fourteen fragments of documents in early Sogdian on silk, paper, and coarse linen.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
Twelve small fragments of a paper document in early Sogdian.
A small fragment of a paper document in early Sogdian.

Fragments, including some nearly complete pages, of a book written on birch-bark containing theSamyuktakāgama, a Sanskrit Buddhist scripture (corresponding to the PaliSamyutta-nikaya), in upright Gupta script of about the end of the 4th century A.D. Published in J.R.A.S., 1913, p. 569 f. 2 sheets glass.
There are a few letters of Kok Turki on the verso.

A large roll of 466 lines, in good Uighur writing, containing a Buddhist Sutra entitledSakiz yukmak boguluk arvis,"the eight magical miracles". It is defective at the beginning. A translation of the ChineseTian di ba yang zhou jingdiffering considerably in vocalism from the MS. found by the Japanese expedition.
Half of a wooden circular tray, 4 inches in diameter, with Uighur writing in top and bottom.

Large paper document in Uighur, 12 1/2 in. wide and same height. Bought atYarkhoto, 26 Nov. 1907. A bill of sale of land, dated on the 1st day of the 12th month of a certain year. The names of the animals of the cyclic year are effaced (line 1, first two words). Issued byAdis (Adi) tarpan. Mentions the namesKhocoandAlp Tas Singguk Sangun.
Three fragments of a paper MS. containing Uighur writing on one side and Chinese (aBuddha-nāma-sūtra) on the other.
Buddhist religious book of 38 ff., 5 7/8 in. wide and 7 3/4 in. high. Uighur writing, with occasional Chinese. See note at end.
Buddhist religious book of 63 ff., 5 1/4 in. wide and 5 3/4 in. high.

msItem.colophon: fol. 46bOn the 4th day of the 6th month of the 10th year of Cu Cing, the year of the tiger, Xulutmak, who is living in the city of Uc-luk-cug (?), copied (this text) by order of Asudai Orul, who has newly learned (Buddhism?) and is the governor of Salir (-uirur?). Dadhu! adgu!

note.p: The 10th year of Cu Cing, 'tiger year', corresponds to A.D. 1350. Cu Cing is probably a corrupt form of zhi zheng of the Yuan Dynasty.)
Six fragments of a paper document with Sogdian writing.
Six fragments of a paper document with Sogdian writing.
Six fragments of a paper document with Sogdian writing.
Six fragments of a paper document with Sogdian writing.
Six fragments of a paper document with Sogdian writing.
A small fragment of Sogdian paper document. From Mazar Tagh
A small fragment of a paper document in Sogdian. From Mazar Tagh.
A fragment of a paper document in Sogdian. From Mazar Tagh.
Five fragments of a paper document in Uighur, with impressions of a Chinese or Tibetan seal. Purchased at Yarkhoto, 29 Nov. 1907.
Five fragments of a paper document in Uighur, with impressions of a Chinese or Tibetan seal. Purchased at Yarkhoto, 29 Nov. 1907.

A large sheet of paper, probably of the Tang period, 18 1/2 in. wide and 9 5/8 in. high. On recto, a fragment of theVajracchedika Prajñā-pāramitā sūtra, in Chinese, in writing of about 700 A.D. On verso, Uighur phrases in a large hand, apparently exercises.
A piece of paper, 12 in. wide and 7 1/4 in. high, with Uighur writing on both sides, relating to gifts of white and red shawls.
A piece of paper, fragmentary, 7 1/2 in. wide and 6 in. high, with Uighur writing on both sides. From a translation of a Jataka.

A large sheet of paper, 2 ft. 2 1/8 in. wide and 9.3/4 in. high, containing on one side a fragment of a Chinese Sutra of thePrajñāpāramitā sūtraclass, and on the other Uighur writing, apparently referring to gifts to some institution.
A sheet of paper written on both sides, containing a Uighur dhāraṇī. Written in Sa-cou. 12 in. wide and 7 1/8 in. high.
A piece of paper written on both sides, containing a part ofSukhāvatīvyūha sūtrain Uighur. 11 1/4 in. wide and 8 1/4 in. high.
A sheet of paper, 16 in. wide and 10 in. high, containing on one side a fragment of the Chinese text of theVimalakīrtinirdeśa sūtrain a hand of ca. 800 A.D.
Uihgur Buddhist text, with phrases of invocation to the Triratna, Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, etc., each repeated twice after line 18.
A sheet of bamboo paper written on both sides, 11 5/8 in. wide and 9 in. high.
A sheet of paper, probably of the Tang period. On recto, a fragment of theVajracchedika Prajñāpāramitā sūtrain Chinese, of the 7th century.
A sheet of paper, 5 1/2 in. wide and 6 1/2 in. high, written on both sides in Uighur. 19 lines.
Five fragments of paper MSS., one being Uighur and three Chinese with Uihgur on verso. (No. d. looks like print.)
Five fragments of paper MSS., one being Uighur and three Chinese with Uihgur on verso. (No. d. looks like print.)
Three paper fragments with Uighur writing on both sides.
A fragment of paper with Chinese on recto and Uighur on verso.
Four fragments of a paper document with Uighur writing.
Three fragments of a paper document with Uighur writing.
Two paper fragments with Uihgur writing. From bill of sale, dated 1st month of Dragon year. With impression of seal.
One medium and one small fragment of an Uighur document on paper, with seal impression.
Eight fragments, mostly illegible, of an Uighur document on paper, purchased at Yar-khoto, 29 Nov. 1907.
One small fragment of a paper document with Uighur writing.
One fragment of a paper document with Uighur writing.
Three fragments of a paper document with Uighur writing.
One fragment of a paper document with Uighur writing.
A fragment of paper, inscribed with Uighur on one side and Chinese on the other.
A fragment of an Uighur letter on paper, with remains of the original silk envelope.
A paper fragment of an Uighur letter.
Two fragments of an Uighur document on paper. Bill of sale.
One Uighur paper fragment. With seal impression.
Two Uighur paper fragments. With seal impression.
Five fragments of an Uighur paper document or letter, and a small rectangular piece of cloth.
A paper fragment of an Uighur letter.
A large fragment of an Uighur bill of sale on paper.
A fragment of an Uighur letter on paper, with impression of a seal.
Two fragments, on paper, of an Uighur letter or book.
Three fragments of a paper Uighur letter or document.
Two fragments of an Uighur Buddhist religious text on paper.
One paper fragment of an Uighur document. A bill of sale, dated 1st day of the 8th month of ... year
Four paper fragments, three with Uighur writing and one with both Uighur and Chinese, together with a small piece of yellow silk.
Four paper fragments, three with Uighur writing and one with both Uighur and Chinese, together with a small piece of yellow silk.
One small piece of paper containing Uighur writing.
Three paper fragments of an Uighur letter or document.
Two fragments of an Uighur Buddhist text.
A number of paper fragments of Uighur books, mostly very minute. One is on the verso of a Chinese MS.
Uighur fragments similar to the preceding.

A fragment of a paper roll. On one side is part of a Sogdian text, the Padmacintāmāṇi-dhāraṇī, in 76 cols., partly imperfect; on the other side, part of a Chinese work on the Abhidharma with commentary.
A paper roll, containing on one side part of the Vimalakīrtinirdeśa in Sogdian (208 lines), and on the other part of a Chinese Sutra. (Ch. 00352. Discarded no. 74. iv. 22.)
A small paper book, 5 1/2 in. by 3 1/2 in., containing a tract on divination in Kok Turki (published in J.R.A.S. 1912), preceded and followed by Buddhist devotional verses in Chinese. 58 ff.

A paper roll, containing on the recto the Chinese text of theSaddharmapuṇḍarīka sūtra, juan 3, pin 7 (somewhat imperfect at the beginning), and on the verso a text in Brahmi script (Khotanese) (Ch. 32.)
A fragment of paper, about 9 in. by 3 in., written in slanting Central Asian script. See "Ancient Khotan," vol. I. p.438, and vol. II. pl. cix.

A large leaf, imperfect in the middle, forming fol. 32 of a MS. of the Sanskrit text of theŚatasāhasrikā-prajñāpāramitā, and containing the end of chap. 8 (Bhūmi-parivarta). See "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p.295, and vol. 2. pl. cvii.
A large paper fragment containing a letter in Persian in Hebrew character. "See Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p. 306, 571., and vol. 2. pl. cxix.

A number of small paper fragments, mostly with Uighur writing on one side and Chinese on the other. The Chinese is at least in three different hands, the oldest being of about the 5th cent. Found stuck together in a mass.

A number of small paper fragments, mostly with Uighur writing on one side and Chinese on the other. The Chinese is at least in three different hands, the oldest being of about the 5th cent. Found stuck together in a mass.

A number of small paper fragments, mostly with Uighur writing on one side and Chinese on the other. The Chinese is at least in three different hands, the oldest being of about the 5th cent. Found stuck together in a mass.

A number of small paper fragments, mostly with Uighur writing on one side and Chinese on the other. The Chinese is at least in three different hands, the oldest being of about the 5th cent. Found stuck together in a mass.
A number of fragments from a MS. of the Tibetan version of theŚālistamba Sūtra. Published in "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p. 548 ff.
A fragment of paper containing two Tibetan passages on ritual. See "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p. 548 ff.
Two fragments of a slip of brownish coarse paper, daubbed with red paint, with a Tibetan inscription of religious content. See "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p.558.
Two fragments of white paper with Tibetan writing, of religious content. See "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1, p. 558.
Eight fragments of paper with Tibetan writing, of religious content. See "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1, p. 559
A sheet of paper containing two religious poems in Tibetan. Published in "Ancient Khotan", vol. 1. p. 561

Two fragments of a paper MS. of aPrajñā-pāramitātext, one of them containing the remnants of a delicately coloured painting (figure of Buddha in circle), of which a head only remains. Found close to the W. outer wall near the S.W. corner. Second expedition.

Long roll, 5 1/2 in. wide, containing the Nila-kantha-dhāraṇī in Sanskrit and Sogdian. Imperfect at beginning. Published (with exception of part at beginning) in J.R.A.S., 1912, p. 629, by Gauthiot and Poussin. No 11.
A fragment of a paper roll containing a Sogdian text, 10 in. by 9 1/2 in., 25 lines. Fine large writing. Found among the Chinese MSS.
A small fragment, 2 1/2 in. by 3 7/8 in., of a paper roll (?) containing a Sogdian text. Superscribed with a Chinese letter or document on both sides. 4 lines. Found among the Chinese MSS.
Small Manichean Turki roll, published in J.R.A.S., 1911, p. 277 ff. by A. von Lecoq.
A letter in Uighur, from ...gan Shigshi, 11 3/4 in. by 6 1/8 in., on paper. Found among the Chinese MSS. from the Thousand Buddhas, in Sir M. A. Stein's Second Expedition.
A fragment of a letter in Uighur, 12 in. by 7 3/8 in., on paper. Found among the Chinese MSS. from the Thousand Buddhas, in Sir M.A. Stein's Second Expedition.
An irregularly shaped fragment of a Buddhist work in Uighur, 11 7/8 in. by 9 in., consisting of six fragments of paper previously cut up and used to patch a Chinese MS.
A fragment of a document in Uighur, 10 in. by 6 in., on paper. Found among the Chinese MSS. from the Thousand Buddhas in Sir M. A. Stein's Second Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.
Five fragments of Chinese documents on paper from Sir M. A. Stein's First Expedition.

Paper roll, 9 ft. 4 in. long and (originally) 9 1/2 in. wide or a little more; inscribed on one side with part ofXuan Zang's Chinese translation of theMahā-prajñā-pāramitā Sūtra(ending with chap. 154), and on the other 80 lines of cursive Brahmi. (Khotanese).
Two fragments of a paper roll containing theYao shi jingin Chinese. On the reverse, Tibetan historical notices. Found among Chinese MSS. from Dunhuang.

A roll of paper, 22 1/2 in. long and 10 in. broad, containing on the obverse a fragment of theVajracchedika Prajñāpāramitā, in Chinese, and on the reverse a Tibetan poem on ethical subjects, incomplete at the end. Found

A piece of striped silk, 4 ft. 6 in. in length from the Buddhist temple atMiran, inscribed in Kharoshthi script with Prakrit prayers for the welfare of the pious donors and their households. See Journal Asiatique, 1911, p.418 f.

A fragment consisting of the conclusion of a Buddhist religious work in Sogdian styledMastkarak casant par un pustak. (5 lines of colophon, one of title, and 31 of text). 20 1/4 in. in length, 10 in. in height. From Dunhuang?
A fragment of an Uighur document on paper. Irregular shape: max. width 7 in., height 5 1/4 in. Found among the Chinese MSS. from Dunhuang.

A fragment of a paper roll, torn across the middle, containing on the obverse a Chinese commentary on theDiamond Sutraand on the reverse a letter or memorandum in Uighur. 18 1/4 in. wide, 4 1/2 in. high.

A fragment of a paper roll, torn across the middle, containing on the obverse a Chinese commentary on theDiamond Sutraand on the reverse a letter or memorandum in Uighur. 18 1/4 in. wide, 4 1/2 in. high.

A Tibetan official document on paper, 12 in. broad and 5 1/2-6 in. high, written in cursive dbu-med; opens with the date "Dog year, spring", and gives instruction on matters of administration. On the reverse, a fragment of a Chinese text.
A paper fragment, 3 3/4 in. by 5 1/8 in., inscribed with Uighur writing.

ThePrajñāpāramitāhṛdayasūtra, in Sanskrit, with Chinese transliteration. Imperfect. Followed by a Chinese text, viz. the"Guanyin Sutra", or chapter XXV of theSaddharmapuṇḍarīka. Folded sheet, 39 in. long and 10 1/4 in. high. 10th century ?
